page.title: 06A PERSONAL VIEW OF SLOUGH
page.content: Slough today, to an outsider, would be the perfect place to live;{near {London, good communications, lots of {jobs, a shopping centre, plenty of {schools}and on the whole good{activity {centres. }The reality is rather different. {Vandalism}is apparent (just as in other towns) throughout Slough and it is not uncommon for the council to repair a telephone kiosk, only to return the next day to replace the glass, because somebody's smashed it again. It seems they are fighting a losing battle. Another one of Slough's pitfalls is the fact that{women and girls}are unable to walk the streets after dark without worrying about who's around the next corner. Almost every week the paper reads{GIRL ATTACKED}and even {MAN KNIFED.
